basic_question: The attitude towards intellectuals marks the civilization of a nation; the attitude towards workers and peasants tests the conscience and conscience of the nation.therefore_______ Which of the following statements can best complete the above argument? A.Intellectuals, workers and farmers should be treated equally. B.How to treat workers and farmers is even more important than how to treat intellectuals. C.Intellectuals can be treated twice as much as workers and farmers. D.Intellectuals should be treated well, as should workers and farmers.

conversations.value: La actitud hacia los intelectuales marca la civilización de una nación; la actitud hacia los trabajadores y campesinos prueba la conciencia y la consciencia de la nación. Entonces, ¿cuál de las siguientes afirmaciones puede completar mejor el argumento anterior? A. Los intelectuales, trabajadores y campesinos deben ser tratados por igual. B. Cómo tratar a los trabajadores y campesinos es aún más importante que cómo tratar a los intelectuales. C. Los intelectuales pueden ser tratados el doble que los trabajadores y campesinos. D. Los intelectuales deben ser tratados bien, al igual que los trabajadores y campesinos.

basic_question: The members of the printing group and the binding group are mainly from the following seven employees-F, G, H, J, K, L and M.The members of each group must meet the following conditions? (1) Each group has at least 3 employees .(2) F and K cannot be in the same group.(3) If K is in a certain group, J must also be in this group.(4) M is at least one of the members of these two groups.(5) At least one of the same employees in both groups. How many employees can be a member of printing group and binding group at most? A.4 B.5 C.6 D.7

conversations.value: 印刷组和装订组的成员主要来自以下七名员工——F,G,H,J,K,L和M。每个组的成员必须满足以下条件？(1)每个组至少有3名员工。(2)F和K不能在同一个组。(3)如果K在某个组，J也必须在这个组。(4)M至少是这两个组中的一个成员。(5)两个组中至少有一个相同的员工。最多有多少员工可以是印刷组和装订组的成员？A.4 B.5 C.6 D.7

basic_question: In the first half of this year, Beijing Kaihua Taxi received twice as many passenger complaints as Beijing Anda Taxi, indicating that Anda Taxi has more standardized management and higher service quality than Kaihua Taxi. If the following statement is true, which one best supports the above conclusion? A.Kaihua Taxi's number of complaints is not as high as that of Anda Taxi. B.Kaihua Taxi's number of complaints has risen faster than that of Anda Taxi. C.Anda Taxi has twice as many vehicles as Kaihua Taxi. D.Complaint calls to Kaihua Taxi are usually longer than complaints to Anda Taxi.

conversations.value: 今年上半年北京凯华出租次数车车上乘客折购比北京安达出租车高出一倍，该结果表明，安达出租车管理更为规范，服务质量更高。如果以下说法是正确的，那个说法最能支持上面的结论？A.凯华出租车折购次数没有安达出租车高。B.凯华出租车折购次数增长速度超过安达出租车。C.安达出租车的车辆数量是凯华出租车的两倍。D.向凯华出租车折购电话通常比向安达出租车折购电话时长。

basic_question: Seven people from G, H, J, K, L, M and O traveled together.In their 4-day camping life, two people are scheduled to cook for everyone every day.It is required that the four-day staff arrangement cannot be repeated, and there is exactly one person on duty for two days.In addition, the duty arrangement must also meet the following conditions? (1) J should be placed on the next day of duty H.(2) The person on duty for two days must be on the fourth day, not the third day.(3) G must be on the same day as one of J and O.(4) Arrange K at least one day on the first or second day.(5) O must be on the third day. Which of the following must be ranked the next day? A.G B.J C.K D.L

conversations.value: 七位G、H、J、K、L、M和O一起旅行。在他们为期4天的露营生活中，每天都有两个人按照预定计划为大家做饭。要求四天的人员安排不能重复，且恰有一个人值班两天。此外，值班安排还必须满足以下条件？（1）J应安排在H值班的次日。（2）连续两天值班的那个人必须在第四天值班，而不是第三天。（3）G必须和J或O中的某一个在同一天值班。（4）K至少有一天在第一天或第二天安排。（5）O必须在第三天值班。下列哪个人必须排在次日值班？A.G B.J C.K D.L

basic_question: Among the pilots who joined the state-owned airlines more than ten years ago, those who later transferred to private airlines now usually have an annual salary of more than one million, while those who remain in the state-owned airlines generally do not exceed 600,000 yuan.These data indicate that the salaries of pilots of state-owned airlines are too low. Which of the following statements is the assumption required for the above conclusion? A.The vast majority of pilots transferred to private airlines believe that the salaries of state-owned airlines are too low. B.Those pilots transferred to private airlines generally have higher ranks and stronger working abilities. C.If those pilots who still stay in state-run airlines also choose to go to private airlines, their annual salary will also exceed one million. D.Private airline pilots and national airline pilots have roughly the same mileage each year.

conversations.value: Among the pilots who joined the state-owned airlines more than ten years ago, those who later transferred to private airlines now usually have an annual salary of more than one million, while those who remain in the state-owned airlines generally do not exceed 600,000 yuan.These data indicate that the salaries of pilots of state-owned airlines are too low. Which of the following statements is the assumption required for the above conclusion? A.The vast majority of pilots transferred to private airlines believe that the salaries of state-owned airlines are too low. B.Those pilots transferred to private airlines generally have higher ranks and stronger working abilities. C.If those pilots who still stay in state-run airlines also choose to go to private airlines, their annual salary will also exceed one million. D.Private airline pilots and national airline pilots have roughly the same mileage each year.

basic_question: There are 6 warehouses in a warehouse, in order from 1 to 6.There are 6 kinds of goods F, G, L, M, P, T.Each warehouse stores exactly one of 6 kinds of goods, and different kinds of goods cannot be stored in the same warehouse.The following conditions must also be met when storing goods? (1) The warehouse number for storing G is larger than the warehouse number for storing L.(2) The warehouse number storing L is larger than the warehouse number storing T.(3) The warehouse number storing P is larger than the warehouse number storing F.(4) The warehouse storing T is next to the warehouse storing P. Which of the following can accurately mark the goods stored in warehouses 1 to 3? A.F, M, T B.G, M, F C.M, L, F D.M, T, F

conversations.value: 有6个仓库，分别为1至6号。其中有6种商品F、G、L、M、P、T。每个仓库存放6种商品中的一种，且同一种商品不能存放在同一个仓库。在存放商品时还需满足以下条件：（1）存放G的仓库号大于存放L的仓库号。（2）存放L的仓库号大于存放T的仓库号。（3）存放P的仓库号大于存放F的仓库号。（4）存放T的仓库与存放P的仓库相邻。以下哪个选项能准确标记1至3号仓库分别存放的商品？A.F, M, T B.G, M, F C.M, L, F D.M, T, F

basic_question: There are 6 scholars F, G, J, L, M, and N, who will speak at a logical meeting, and the speeches are arranged in the following order? (1) Each speaker speaks only once, and only once at the same time By.(2) Three speakers speak before lunch, and the other three speak after lunch.(3) G must speak before lunch.(4) Only one speaker is between M and N.(5) F speaks in the first or third place. If J is the fourth speaker, who must be the third speaker? A.F or M C.L or N B.G or L D.M or N

conversations.value: There are 6 scholars F, G, J, L, M, and N, who will speak at a logical meeting, and the speeches are arranged in the following order? (1) Each speaker speaks only once, and only once at the same time By.(2) Three speakers speak before lunch, and the other three speak after lunch.(3) G must speak before lunch.(4) Only one speaker is between M and N.(5) F speaks in the first or third place. If J is the fourth speaker, who must be the third speaker? A.F or M C.L or N B.G or L D.M or N

basic_question: In the novel "Article 22 Military Regulations" of the American writer Joseph Heller, Article 22 Military Regulations stipulates that only when a soldier's mental status is abnormal and he applies for suspension of flight, can he be allowed to stop flying.According to common sense, if a soldier is aware of the danger of flying and submits an application to stop flying, it shows that his mind is clear and his spirit cannot be abnormal. Which of the following statements is the logical inference above? A.If a person is mentally abnormal, he will be allowed to stop flying. B.No one can be allowed to stop flying. C.If a person can realize that there is a danger of flying, it shows that he is mentally normal. D.If a person can file an application to stop flying, it shows that his spirit cannot be abnormal.

conversations.value: Amerikalı yazar Joseph Heller'in "Madde 22 Askeri Yönetmelik" adlı romanında, Madde 22 Askeri Yönetmelik, sadece bir askerin zihinsel durumu anormal olduğunda ve uçuşun askıya alınması için başvurduğunda, uçuşu durdurmasına izin verilir. Akıl sağlığı açısından, eğer bir asker uçmanın tehlikesinin farkında ve uçmayı durdurma başvurusu yaparsa, bu zihninin açık ve ruhunun anormal olamayacağını gösterir. Aşağıdakilerden hangisi yukarıdaki mantıksal çıkarımdır? A. Eğer bir kişi zihinsel olarak anormalse, uçmayı durdurmasına izin verilir. B. Hiç kimseye uçmayı durdurma izni verilemez. C. Eğer bir kişi uçmanın tehlikesini fark edebilirse, bu onun zihinsel olarak normal olduğunu gösterir. D. Eğer bir kişi uçmayı durdurma başvurusu yapabiliyorsa, ruhunun anormal olamayacağını gösterir.

basic_question: It is generally believed that the result of tossing a coin of uniform quality is random.But in fact, the result of tossing is determined by the momentum of the coin toss and the initial height.Nonetheless, it is very difficult to accurately predict the outcome of a coin toss. Which of the following is most helpful in explaining the phenomenon mentioned in the title, that is, the result of the throw is determined by certain factors, but it is difficult to predict? A.For a long time, tossing coins has been used as a typical example of random events. B.If you toss a coin of uneven quality, the result can always be accurately predicted. C.If the initial height of the coin toss remains stable, the result of the coin toss will be determined solely by the tossing force. D.Accurate prediction of coin tossing results requires accurate estimation of the initial height and impulse of coin tossing.

conversations.value: It is generally believed that the result of tossing a coin of uniform quality is random. But in fact, the result of tossing is determined by the momentum of the coin toss and the initial height. Nonetheless, it is very difficult to accurately predict the outcome of a coin toss. Which of the following is most helpful in explaining the phenomenon mentioned in the title, that is, the result of the throw is determined by certain factors, but it is difficult to predict? A.For a long time, tossing coins has been used as a typical example of random events. B.If you toss a coin of uneven quality, the result can always be accurately predicted. C.If the initial height of the coin toss remains stable, the result of the coin toss will be determined solely by the tossing force. D.Accurate prediction of coin tossing results requires accurate estimation of the initial height and impulse of coin tossing.

basic_question: For listed companies, only companies with dividends can issue new stocks.However, if a company has a dividend, it does not need funds.If it needs financing, there is no way to pay dividends. If the above statement is true, which statement cannot be true? A.A listed company needs financing and has no way to pay dividends. B.A listed company either needs financing or has no way to pay dividends. C.A listed company does not need financing, it will definitely pay dividends. D.A listed company needs both financing and dividends.

conversations.value: For listed companies, only companies with dividends can issue new stocks.However, if a company has a dividend, it does not need funds.If it needs financing, there is no way to pay dividends. If the above statement is true, which statement cannot be true? A.A listed company needs financing and has no way to pay dividends. B.A listed company either needs financing or has no way to pay dividends. C.A listed company does not need financing, it will definitely pay dividends. D.A listed company needs both financing and dividends.

If the above statement is true, which statement cannot be true? A.A listed company needs financing and has no way to pay dividends. B.A listed company either needs financing or has no way to pay dividends. C.A listed company does not need financing, it will definitely pay dividends. D.A listed company needs both financing and dividends.

conversations.value: For listed companies, only companies with dividends can issue new stocks.However, if a company has a dividend, it does not need funds.If it needs financing, there is no way to pay dividends. If the above statement is true, which statement cannot be true? A.A listed company needs financing and has no way to pay dividends. B.A listed company either needs financing or has no way to pay dividends. C.A listed company does not need financing, it will definitely pay dividends. D.A listed company needs both financing and dividends.
Are you sure? Please check each condition carefully!

basic_question: Three Chinese students Zhang Lin, Zhao Qiang, Li Shan and three foreign students John, Jesse, and Anna went on a summer vacation.Alternative tourist destinations include Xi'an, Hangzhou, Dalian and Zhangjiajie.It is already known that? (1) each person can only go to one place; (2) wherever Chinese students go, foreign students must go; (3) where there are foreign students, Chinese students must go; (4) John went to Xi'an or Hangzhou, and Zhao Qiang went to Zhangjiajie. If Jesse goes to Dalian, which of the following must be true? A.Anna went to Zhangjiajie. C.Li Shan went to Xi'an. B.Zhang Lin went to Dalian. D.John went to Hangzhou.

conversations.value: Three Chinese students Zhang Lin, Zhao Qiang, Li Shan and three foreign students John, Jesse, and Anna went on a summer vacation. Alternative tourist destinations include Xi'an, Hangzhou, Dalian and Zhangjiajie. It is already known that (1) each person can only go to one place; (2) wherever Chinese students go, foreign students must go; (3) where there are foreign students, Chinese students must go; (4) John went to Xi'an or Hangzhou, and Zhao Qiang went to Zhangjiajie. If Jesse goes to Dalian, which of the following must be true? A.Anna went to Zhangjiajie. C.Li Shan went to Xi'an. B.Zhang Lin went to Dalian. D.John went to Hangzhou.
If Zhang Lin went to Dalian with Jesse, where did Li Shan go?
Can you determine where John went given the information we have?
In that case, can we determine where Anna went?

basic_question: There are five stations set up from west to east along a section of the high-speed railway along the river.It is known that Fuyi Station is east of Haoyun Station and West of Huyao Station, and is adjacent to Huyao Station; Jiushang Station is adjacent to Yinling Station. If Haoyun Station is adjacent to Yinling Station, you can get? A.Yinling is standing west of Haoyun Station B.Fuyi standing west of Jiushang Station C.Hao Yun stands west of Yinling Station D.Jiu Shang standing west of Fuyi Station

conversations.value: 已知沿河高铁一段设有五个站点，从西往东依次排列。知道富义站在豪运站的东边，互崖站的西边，并且与互崖站相邻；久上站与银陵站相邻。如果豪运站与银陵站相邻，那么可以得出什么结论？A.银陵站在豪运站的西边 B.富义站在久上站的西边 C.豪运站在银陵站的西边 D.久上站在富义站的西边

basic_question: Computer scientists have discovered two computer viruses called "Alibaba" and "Forty Thieves." These viruses often invade computer system files, preventing the correct storage of computer files.Fortunately, there is currently no evidence that these two viruses can completely delete computer files, so computer users who find these two viruses do not have to worry about their files being erased. The above argument is wrong because it? A.Support it with evidence that merely restates the conclusion. B.This fact is not considered? causality that has not been proven, one can also assume the existence of such a relationship. C.This possibility is not considered? even if the causal relationship has not been proven, the relationship still exists. D.It does not describe the technical mechanism by which computer viruses delete files.

conversations.value: 计算机科学家发现了两种计算机病毒，名为“阿里巴巴”和“四十大盗”。这些病毒经常侵入计算机系统文件，阻止计算机文件的正确存储。幸运的是，目前没有证据表明这两种病毒可以完全删除计算机文件，因此发现这两种病毒的计算机用户不必担心他们的文件被抹去。以上论证错误，因为它？A.用证据支持它，仅重述结论。B.没有考虑这个事实？未经证实的因果关系，人们也可以假设存在这种关系。C.没有考虑这种可能性？即使因果关系没有被证明，关系仍然存在。D.它没有描述计算机病毒删除文件的技术机制。

basic_question: There are 90 patients, all suffering from refractory disease T, who have taken the same conventional drugs.These patients were divided into two groups of equal numbers.The first group took W, an experimental drug used to treat T, and the second group took placebo without W.Statistics after 10 years show that 44 deaths occurred in both groups.Therefore, this test drug is ineffective. Which of the following, if true, would most weaken the above argument? A.Among the patients who died above, the average year of death of the second group was two years earlier than the first group. B.Among the patients who died, the average life span of the second group was two years shorter than that of the first group. C.Among the above living patients, the second group is more severely ill than the first group. D.Among the above living patients, the second group is older than the first group.

conversations.value: 有90名患者，都患有难治性疾病T，这些患者都服用了相同的常规药物。这些患者被平均分为两组。第一组服用了W药物，这是用于治疗T的实验性药物；第二组则服用了不含W的安慰剂。10年后的统计数据显示，两组中共有44人死亡。因此，这种试验药物是无效的。下列哪一项，如果为真，最能削弱上述论证？A.在上述死亡患者中，第二组的平均死亡年份比第一组早两年。B.在死亡患者中，第二组的平均寿命比第一组短两年。C.在上述尚存活的患者中，第二组的病情比第一组严重。D.在上述尚存活的患者中，第二组的年龄比第一组大。

basic_question: Dai Wei had almost no stomach problems after eating dairy products.Just because he occasionally had stomach pains after eating dairy products, it was concluded that he had no allergy to dairy products. Which argument is most similar to the reasoning above? A.Dogs and cats are sometimes anxious before the earthquake, so there is no reason to conclude that dogs and cats have the ability to sense earthquakes in advance, because in most cases, there is no earthquake after dogs and cats are anxious. B.Although many people lose weight through short-term diets, it is unreasonable to believe that such diets are effective for weight loss. C.Most hypotheses have a large number of supporting examples before they become scientific theories.It is unreasonable to think that a hypothesis is a scientific theory just because it is successfully applied to a few cases. D.Although many chain stores are more profitable, it is unreasonable to attribute the success of this business model to this business model, because only well-funded businesses can do so.

conversations.value: 戴伟在吃过乳制品后几乎没有胃部问题。仅仅因为他偶尔在吃过乳制品后出现胃痛，就得出他对乳制品没有过敏的结论。以下哪个论点最接近上述推理？A.狗和猫在地震前有时会焦虑，所以没有理由得出狗和猫有提前感知地震的能力，因为在大多数情况下，狗和猫焦虑后并没有地震发生。B.尽管很多人通过短期节食减轻体重，但认为这种节食方式对减肥有效是不合理的。C.在成为科学理论之前，大多数假设有大量支持的例子。仅仅因为成功应用于几个案例，就认为一个假设是科学理论是不合理的。D.尽管很多连锁店更赚钱，但认为这个商业模式的成功归功于这个商业模式是不合理的，因为只有资金充足的企业才能做到。

basic_question: The mode in which the government and private enterprises cooperate to complete a project (referred to as PPP) can enable the government to obtain funds, and can also allow social capital to enter the public utility fields such as power and railway.The problem with this model is that the government defaults or investors default, causing economic losses to the other party.In past PPP projects, government default was not a small probability event.Although local government defaults are not uncommon, investors continue to actively invest in PPP projects as always. If any of the following statements are true, can we best explain the seemingly contradictory phenomenon? A.With the reform of the economic system and the promotion of new urbanization, the PPP model has high hopes from all walks of life B.The PPP model is more complicated, and the local government ’s bargaining power and PPP expertise are not as good as those of investors. C.This year, the National Development and Reform Commission released 80 important projects to encourage social capital to participate in construction and operation through PPP and other means D.In order to prevent economic losses caused by local government defaults, investors try to transfer other interests to their own enterprises

conversations.value: 政府和私营企业合作完成项目的模式（称为PPP）可以使政府获得资金，并允许社会资本进入电力和铁路等公共事业领域。这个模式的问题是政府违约或投资者违约，给另一方造成经济损失。在过去的PPP项目中，政府违约并非小概率事件。尽管地方政府违约并不罕见，但投资者仍然一如既往地积极投资PPP项目。如果以下哪个陈述是正确的，我们可以最好地解释这种看似矛盾的现象？A.随着经济体制的改革和新型城镇化的推进，PPP模式受到了各界的高度期望 B.PPP模式较为复杂，地方政府的议价能力和PPP专业知识不如投资者。C.今年国家发改委放出80个重大项目，鼓励社会资本通过PPP等方式参与建设和运营 D.为防止地方政府违约造成的经济损失，投资者试图将其他利益转移到自己的企业。

basic_question: This year, Taifeng, a subsidiary of Huatai Group, set a new annual sales record.This is quite surprising, because Taifeng's potential market is the smallest, and it has always been the lowest sales department of all Huatai Group's subsidiaries. Which of the following statements points out the problems in the above discussion? A.Since Taifeng has the smallest potential market, it is not surprising that it is the lowest sales department of Huatai Group. B.If the total sales of Huatai Group increased this year, it is not surprising that the sales of Taifeng Company increased. C.Whether the sales of each branch company sets an annual sales record is only the result of the company's self-comparison, and does not need to be compared with other branch companies. D.If the other subsidiaries of the group have created annual sales records, it is not surprising that Taifeng has set a new annual sales record.

conversations.value: Este año, Taifeng, una subsidiaria de Huatai Group, estableció un nuevo récord de ventas anuales. Esto es bastante sorprendente, porque el mercado potencial de Taifeng es el más pequeño y siempre ha sido el departamento de ventas más bajo de todas las subsidiarias de Huatai Group. ¿Cuál de las siguientes afirmaciones señala los problemas en la discusión anterior? A. Ya que Taifeng tiene el mercado potencial más pequeño, no es sorprendente que sea el departamento de ventas más bajo de Huatai Group. B. Si las ventas totales de Huatai Group aumentaron este año, no es sorprendente que las ventas de Taifeng Company aumenten. C. Si cada compañía filial establece un récord de ventas anuales es solo el resultado de la comparación propia de la empresa y no necesita ser comparado con otras compañías filiales. D. Si las otras subsidiarias del grupo han creado récords de ventas anuales, no es sorprendente que Taifeng haya establecido un nuevo récord de ventas anuales.

basic_question: In recent years, graduate entrance examinations have continued to heat up.Correspondingly, a variety of postgraduate counseling classes have emerged, especially English and political counseling classes are almost a must for the postgraduates.Xiaozhuang, who has just started working, also intends to take the postgraduate entrance exam, so Xiaozhuang must take English tutoring classes Which of the following can best strengthen the above argument A.If you take an English tutoring class, you can pass the graduate entrance exam B.Only those who intend to take the graduate entrance exam will participate in the English tutoring class C.Even if you take an English tutoring class, you may not be able to pass the graduate entrance exam D.If you do not participate in the English tutoring class, you cannot pass the graduate entrance exam

conversations.value: 近年来，研究生入学考试持续升温。相应地，各种研究生辅导课也应运而生，尤其是英语和政治辅导课程几乎是考研学生的必备课程。刚参加工作的小壮也打算参加研究生入学考试，因此小壮必须参加英语辅导课程。以下哪项能最好地加强以上论证？A.参加英语辅导课程，就可以通过研究生入学考试 B.只有那些打算参加研究生入学考试的人会参加英语辅导课程 C.即使参加英语辅导课程，也未必能通过研究生入学考试 D.如果不参加英语辅导课程，就无法通过研究生入学考试

basic_question: Since the Axka Exxon tanker disaster in 1989 and the 1991 Middle East war, the price of aviation fuel has risen dramatically.During the same period, the prices of several petroleum derivatives also rose sharply.These two facts indicate that aviation fuel is a petroleum derivative. Which of the following statements best evaluates the above argument? A.Good thinking, because aviation fuel is a petroleum derivative. B.Bad thinking does not accurately state all the facts. C.Bad thinking, food prices have risen during the same period, but this does not prove that aviation fuel is food. D.Bad thinking, given the facts about petroleum derivatives, cannot draw any conclusions about aviation fuel.

conversations.value:
自1989年阿克萨埃克森油轮灾难和1991年中东战争以来，航空燃料价格大幅上涨。同一时期，几种石油衍生物价格也急剧上涨。这两个事实表明，航空燃料是石油衍生物。以下哪个陈述最好地评估了上述论点？
A.好的思考，因为航空燃料是石油衍生物。
B.不好的思考，并未准确陈述所有事实。
C.不好的思考，同期食品价格也上涨，但这并不能证明航空燃料是食品。
D.不好的思考，根据有关石油衍生物的事实，无法得出关于航空燃料的任何结论。

basic_question: twenty three.Zhang Hua said to Wang Lei? You told me that as the legal owner of the company, as long as I want, I have the right to sell it.However, you told me that if I sold it, the loyal employees would suffer misfortune, so I have no right to do so.Obviously, your two claims are inconsistent. Which of the following statements best describes the flaws in Zhang Hua ’s inference? A.Zhang Hua ignored that his employees also had the rights related to the sale of the company. B.Zhang Hua did not provide sufficient and reliable reasons for selling his company. C.Zhang Hua's right not to sell his company now does not mean that he never has the right to sell it. D.Zhang Hua confuses company ownership with responsibility for loyal employees.

conversations.value: 张华对王磊说？你告诉我作为公司的合法拥有者，只要我愿意，我有权把它卖掉。但是，你又告诉我，如果我把它卖掉了，忠诚的员工会遭到不幸，所以我无权这样做。显然，你的两个说法是不一致的。以下哪个选项最能描述张华推断的错误？A.张华忽略了他的员工也有与公司出售相关的权利。B.张华没有提供足够且可靠的理由出售他的公司。C.张华现在没有权利卖掉他的公司，并不意味着他以后永远没有权利卖掉。D.张华混淆了公司所有权与对忠诚员工的责任。

basic_question: Among vertebrate fossils, shark teeth are one of the most common fossils.However, the fossils of shark skeletons are very rare.Compared with the discovery of skeleton fossils of other vertebrates, the discovery of shark skeleton fossils is better than nothing. If any of the following statements are true, will it be most helpful to resolve the doubts above? A.The shark's teeth need to be replaced many times in its lifetime, but the shark's skeleton is not changed for life, only one skeleton. B.Compared to the skeletons of teeth or other vertebrates, shark cartilage skeletons are less likely to form fossils. C.The process of petrification of the shark skeleton is the same as the physical changes experienced by the petrification of the shark teeth. D.It is indeed confusing to find the skeleton fossil where the shark tooth fossil was found.

conversations.value: 脊椎动物化石中，鲨鱼牙齿是最常见的化石之一。然而，鲨鱼骨骼的化石却非常罕见。与其他脊椎动物的骨骼化石相比，发现鲨鱼骨骼化石是凤毛麟角。如果以下陈述中有哪一个是正确的，那么最有助于解决上述疑虑？A.鲨鱼的牙齿需要在其一生中多次更换，但是鲨鱼的骨骼一生只有一个，不更换。B.与牙齿或其他脊椎动物的骨骼相比，鲨鱼软骨骨骼形成化石的可能性较小。C.鲨鱼骨骼的石化过程与鲨鱼牙齿石化所经历的物理变化是相同的。D.确实在找到鲨鱼牙齿化石的地方发现骨骼化石是令人困惑的。
